attributes.action: Spend the £29.5 million earmarked enforce the smoking ban on removing guns from our streets
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government has earmarked £29.5 million for local authorities to enforce the new smoking ban.
Would it not make more sense to use this money to help rid our streets of guns and the people who use them?
Rumour has it that the government is to reduce spending on the removal of guns and not increase it!

rejection.details: A similar petition already exists http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/SmokingPolice/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
